item.text: Weâ€™d like to ask you a few questions about your pain and how it is affecting your life. Please describe the location(s) of any pain you have had in the past 7 days.
What type of UPPER BACK pain?
What type of LOWER BACK pain?
What type of UPPER LEGS pain?
What type of LOWER LEGS pain?
Thinking about your overall pain, in the past 7 days, please respond to the questions below:
How intense was your pain at its worst?
How intense was your average pain?
What is your level of pain right now?
Thinking about your overall pain, in the past 7 days, please respond to the questions below:
How much did pain interfere with your day to day activities?
How much did pain interfere with your work around the home?
How much did pain interfere with your ability to participate in social activities?
How much did pain interfere with your household chores?
Thinking about your overall pain, in the past 7 days, please respond to the questions below:
How much did pain interfere with the things you usually do for fun?
How much did pain interfere with your enjoyment of social activities?
How much did pain interfere with your enjoyment of life?
How much did pain interfere with your family life?

Weâ€™d like to know more about how you manage your pain and what has worked for you. When answering these questions, please focus on pain related to what brings you in for your upcoming medical visit.

These treatments are organized into sections by type:
Basic therapies
Mind-body therapies
New therapies
Non-prescription medicines
Prescription medicines
What have you tried in the past 6 months to help you with your pain? Select all answers that apply. We also want to know if it worked for you.

item.prefix: Exercises at home (such as those assigned by a therapist) or outside (such as walking, jogging, swimming)
Weight loss or changes in your diet

item.text: Which of the mind-body therapies below have you used to help with your pain in the last 6 months (select all that apply)?

item.prefix: Group or individual therapy for pain
Sleep management (such as a sleep study or CPAP)

item.text: Which of the new therapies below have you used to help with your pain in the last 6 months (select all that apply)?
Which of the items you can buy without a prescription from your doctor below have you used to help with your pain in the last 6 months (select all that apply)?

item.prefix: Pain relievers (such as Advil, Aleve, Aspirin, Ibuprofen, Motrin, or Tylenol)
Herbal or nutritional pain relievers (such as ginseng or kava kava)
Cremes, lotions, gels or patches applied to the skin (for example BENGAYÂ®, TIGER BALMÂ® or BiOFREEZEÂ®)

item.text: Which of the prescription medications below have you used to help with your pain in the last 6 months (select all that apply)?

item.prefix: Opioid medications (such as hydrocodone, oxycodone, codeine, morphine and fentanyl)
Cortisone injection (a shot to relieve inflammation)
Non-opioid medications as prescribed by a doctor (such as Celebrex or Cymbalta)

item.text:
We'd like to know more about you and your activity goals (for example, I'd like to be able to walk without pain). Please describe, in your own words, your most important activity goals.

What are your most important activity goals?

We'd like to know what makes it hard for you to reach your activity goals. What are the biggest barriers to achieving your activity goals (for example, I have a lot of stress from work which makes my pain worse). Please describe, in your own words, barriers to reaching your most important activity goals.

What are the biggest barriers to achieving your activity goals?

Below is a link to a video produced by the American Chronic Pain Association about living with chronic pain. Weâ€™d like to suggest you watch the video to help you prepare for your upcoming visit. This video can help you prepare to ask questions that are important to you when you visit with your provider.

The website linked below provides some information from the U.S. Pain Foundation about the causes and diagnosis of pain in general, treatment options and self management and well-being when living with pain. This information can help you prepare to ask questions that are important to you when you visit with your provider.

Please indicate your level of agreement with the following statement:

Using the MyPAIN tool has helped me begin preparing for a conversation with my provider about managing my pain.
Do you have any other feedback or thoughts to share on your use of MyPAIN?
